subject: Sleep
title: ADHD Sleep Hygiene Strategies
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: ADHD Sleep Hygiene Strategies.

hook.text: Standard sleep advice says relax before bed. For an ADHD brain, relaxing on command is nearly impossible.

buildup.text: Generic sleep hygiene tips often fail for ADHD because they assume intact executive function.

discovery.text: ADHD-specific strategies use external structure: timers, routines, physical separation from devices, and body-based cues.

twist.text: Weighted blankets provide deep pressure stimulation that calms the ADHD nervous system and speeds sleep onset.

climax.text: Building a rigid, externalized bedtime system compensates for the brain's weak internal regulation.

punchline.text: ADHD sleep hygiene means building the structure your brain can't.

quiz.question: Why do standard sleep hygiene tips often fail for ADHD?
options: People with ADHD don't need sleep
They assume intact executive function that ADHD impairs
ADHD patients are resistant to all advice
